title: Lacey Turner wraps up in a furry leopard print coat as she enjoys stroll with newborn baby Dusty
text:
She is revelling in being a first-time mum after giving birth to her daughter in July.

And Lacey Turner was every inch the devoted parent as she enjoyed a stroll with newborn Dusty in London on Wednesday.

The EastEnders actress, 31, wrapped up in a furry coat as she wheeled her baby girl along in a pram on a scenic park walk.

Cute: Lacey Turner was every inch the devoted parent as she enjoyed a stroll with newborn Dusty in London on Wednesday

Outing: The EastEnders actress, 31, wrapped up in a furry coat as she wheeled her baby girl along in a pram on a scenic park walk

The star's burnt orange coat featured jazzy leopard print lapels, with the Stacey Slater actress pairing this with pastel pink joggers and trainers.

Her brunette locks were styled sleek and straight while she showcased her radiant complexion by going make-up free.

Little Dusty appeared to be sleeping soundly in her pram as a doting Lacey walked along

Lacey welcomed her firstborn with husband Matt Kay on July 12, after enduring the trauma of two miscarriages.

Autumn chic: The star's burnt orange coat featured jazzy leopard print lapels, with the Stacey Slater actress pairing this with pastel pink joggers and trainers

Walk: Her brunette locks were styled sleek and straight while she showcased her radiant complexion by going make-up free

The star first revealed she was pregnant with her first child to OK Magazine in February, showing off her bump as she posed with her husband Matt.

The couple, who are childhood sweethearts, had been closely monitoring the pregnancy with Dusty.

Lacey said: 'I can’t wait to nurture our baby – we’ve dreamed of having a family for so long.

Special moments: Little Dusty appeared to be sleeping soundly in her pram as a doting Lacey walked along

Refreshed: Stacey looked relaxed as she walked along pushing the pram

Sweet: Lacey shared an adorable snap taken from her little tot's first holiday with her and husband Matt Kay in Singapore last month

'When you’ve lost babies all you care about is the heartbeat - we’ve had about 12 scans’.

She previously said of her husband: 'I just feel really lucky. It's really rare to spend this many years with someone and to still feel the same as it did in the beginning.

'We don't know any different, I guess, but I know we definitely feel lucky.'
description: Lacey Turner was every inch the devoted parent as she enjoyed a stroll with newborn Dusty in London on Wednesday.
